title: Japan optimism has been fueled by 'game-changing' reforms and Warren Buffett: Here's what you need to know
description: Increased foreign investment will push cash-rich Japanese companies towards greater profitability and efficient capital allocation.

title: Trump arrives in Miami for arraignment on first ever federal charges against an ex-president
description: Former President Donald Trump arrived in Miami, where he is expected to surrender to authorities in a federal criminal probe Tuesday.

title: FTC files to block Microsoft-Activision Blizzard deal
description: The FTC on Monday filed a temporary restraining order and preliminary injunction seeking to block Microsoft’s proposed acquisition of Activision Blizzard.

title: Senator opens investigation into PGA Tour merger with Saudi-backed LIV Golf
description: The sudden merger between PGA Tour and Saudi-owned Liv Golf has invited scrutiny from federal lawmakers.

title: Oracle beats on top and bottom lines as cloud revenue jumps
description: Oracle's cloud infrastructure revenue growth accelerated in the quarter, although revenue from cloud and on-premises licenses declined.

title: The world's top H.P. Lovecraft expert weighs in on a monstrous viral meme in the A.I. world
description: The shoggoth meme is a metaphor for concerns that artificial intelligence could one day become indifferent to humans.

title: Inflation report Tuesday will be critical for the direction of Fed policy
description: The consumer price index is expected to show that all-items inflation increased just 0.1% last month, equating to a 4% annual rate.

title: Google and OpenAI limit A.I. chatbots in Hong Kong amid China tensions, report says
description: Google and OpenAI, which has partnered with Microsoft, have restricted access to their powerful artificial intelligence chatbots in Hong Kong.

title: Twitter CEO Linda Yaccarino echoes Musk in emphasizing freedom of speech in debut tweet thread
description: Twitter's new CEO Linda Yaccarino made her first substantive public comments on Monday, laying out her focus on freedom of speech

title: The Golden Globes find new home as the Hollywood Foreign Press shutters
description: Dick Clark Productions has acquired all of the assets, rights and properties of the Golden Globes from the Hollywood Foreign Press Association.

title: Stocks making the biggest moves midday: Carnival, Nasdaq, Oracle, KeyCorp and more
description: These are the stocks posting the largest moves midday.

title: Andreessen Horowitz to open first office outside the U.S. in London in bet UK will become crypto hub
description: Andreessen Horowitz, a major U.S. technology investor, said it plans to open its first international office in London.

title: British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak pitches UK as home of A.I. safety regulation as London bids to be next Silicon Valley
description: "I want to make the U.K. not just the intellectual home but the geographical home of global AI safety regulation," Sunak said at a packed tech event Monday.

title: FTC will try to block Microsoft's acquisition of Activision Blizzard
description: The FTC had already sued to block the $68.7 billion acquisition, choosing to bring the case before its internal administrative law judge.

title: Grubhub lays off 15% of corporate workforce, or about 400 employees
description: Food delivery company Grubhub said it would lay off 15% of its corporate workforce, or 400 employees, citing a need to maintain competitiveness.

title: Goldman Sachs CEO David Solomon warns of pain ahead for commercial real estate
description: The commercial real estate industry is in the throes of a painful adjustment to higher borrowing costs and lower occupancy rates.

title: The 15-inch MacBook Air offers superb battery life and portability at an aggressive price
description: It's probably the best laptop for most people if you like the MacOS operating system and plan to use it for everyday tasks.

title: GM to invest $632 million to produce next-generation pickups in Indiana
description: The investment is the automaker's third such announcement in the past week involving GM's next-generation large trucks and SUVs.

title: JPMorgan settles with Epstein victim after her lawyers pushed for new Dimon deposition
description: Other suits in the Epstein matter remain open, however, including the U.S. Virgin Islands' suit and a case against former executive Jes Staley.

title: HSBC builds innovation division from the bones of collapsed SVB UK
description: HSBC unveiled its new HSBC Innovation Banking unit Monday, following its eleventh-hour rescue of the U.K. subsidiary of SVB in March.

title: Silvio Berlusconi, billionaire media mogul and former Italian prime minister, dies at 86
description: Silvio Berlusconi was the billionaire Italian media mogul who served as the country's prime minister three times over a period of nine years.

title: Nio cuts prices for its cars — and delays business expansion plans
description: Chinese electric car brand Nio cut prices for its cars by the equivalent of $4,200 and ended free battery swaps for new buyers.

title: Goldman Sachs slashes oil price forecast by nearly 10% as Russian supply recovers
description: Russia's oil production has remained resilient even in the face of Western sanctions.

title: A subsection of tech is set to be worth $1 trillion. But taboos are holding it back
description: The FemTech sector is set to be worth $1 trillion by 2027, but the "taboo" nature of women's health is one factor preventing the industry from getting funding.

title: UBS says it has completed the takeover of stricken rival Credit Suisse
description: Swiss bank UBS released an open letter Monday saying that it had formally completed the takeover of its rival Credit Suisse.

title: Crypto prices stabilize after plunging on SEC crackdown jitters
description: Crypto prices are showing signs of stabilization after a market sell-off.

title: Saudi Arabia is seeking collaboration not competition with China, energy minister says
description: Saudi Arabia is seeking more cooperation with China on trade investments and energy flows rather than competing with it, said Saudi's energy minister.

title: Ahead of Blinken's Beijing visit, Singapore urges the U.S. and China to stave off conflict
description: Confrontation and conflict between China and the U.S. is "not an inevitability," Singapore Deputy Prime Minister Heng Swee Kiat said.

title: George Soros hands control of his $25 billion empire to his son Alex
description: The older Soros, often targeted by right-wing conspiracists, has been one of the U.S. Democratic Party's largest donors.

title: What one key business indicator is saying about China's consumer recovery
description: Businesses in China are spending cautiously on advertising this year as local consumption isn't expected to bounce back for a while yet.

title: Investors are eyeing China's neighbors as the recovery from 'zero-Covid' slows
description: Stock markets in South Korea, Japan and India are beneficiaries of the disappointing economic data that has clipped confidence in China.
